intro: Heteromorpha abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian wild cucumber, is a climbing vine native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers, squashes, and gourds. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that give way to elongated, spiny fruits. Its botanical characteristics include a hairy stem and tendrils that aid in climbing. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
